title: Permadeaf
data:
**Permadeaf** is an [unofficial conduct](/wiki/Unofficial_conduct "Unofficial conduct") in some [variants](/wiki/Variants "Variants") of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that requires the hero to be [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf") for the entire game.

To activate permanent deafness, you must set `OPTIONS=deaf` before starting the game - checking your stats refers to this conduct as **deaf from birth**. Once activated, the conduct is automatic, and there is no way for the hero to break the conduct or to cure deafness, even with an artifact.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit ffb61612](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ffb61612e3fce17cef660d4a69e3fe447676a955), permadeaf becomes an official conduct, and is logged in the `achieveX` field in [xlogfile](/wiki/Xlogfile "Xlogfile").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Restrictions](#Restrictions)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 TNNT (the game)](#TNNT_.28the_game.29)
  - [2.2 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [2.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [3 References](#References)

## Restrictions

Being permadeaf entails the following:

- You cannot use the #[chat](/wiki/Chat "Chat") extended command.
- You cannot use a [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope").
- You will not hear "ambient" sounds, e.g. from [vaults](/wiki/Vaults "Vaults") and [shops](/wiki/Shops "Shops").
  - However, if you visit a shop, the [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") will accommodate you; you can still buy, sell, and price-identify.
- You cannot chat with [aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priests "Aligned priests") and therefore cannot purchase divine protection or other benefits; aligned priests do not accommodate deaf worshipers.
- You cannot chat with a [foocubus](/wiki/Foocubus "Foocubus") to initiate an encounter. However, a hostile foocubus may still initiate an encounter with you; foocubi will not ask you permission or talk to you about removing your armor, and will instead silently decide whether or not to remove each armor piece.
- If your [quest leader](/wiki/Quest_leader "Quest leader") starts roaming, you cannot [chat](/wiki/Chat "Chat") to them. However, the quest leader will still speak to you if you corner them in a corridor or other spot where they have nowhere to move.

## Variants

### TNNT (the game)

In [TNNT (the game)](/wiki/TNNT_\(the_game\) "TNNT (the game)"), the permadeaf conduct is available, and there is an achievement for receiving the quest with the permadeaf conduct intact. In the [DevTeam quest](/wiki/DevTeam_quest "DevTeam quest"), you cannot chat to [devteam member](/wiki/Devteam_member "Devteam member") Mike Stephenson, but can still complete the quest by [throwing](/wiki/Throw "Throw") each [scroll of missing code](/wiki/Scroll_of_missing_code "Scroll of missing code") to him.

In the 2022 [tournament](/wiki/The_November_NetHack_Tournament "The November NetHack Tournament"), 4 players earned this achievement.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) In the 2023 tournament, 4 players earned this achievement.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

### xNetHack

[xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack") offers the permadeaf conduct.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") offers the permadeaf conduct.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") offers the permadeaf conduct.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://hardfought.org/tnnt/archives/2022/achievements>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://tnnt.org/achievements>

From NetHackWiki

Permadeaf is an unofficial conduct in some variants of NetHack that requires the hero to be deaf for the entire game.

To activate permanent deafness, you must set OPTIONS=deaf before starting the game - checking your stats refers to this conduct as deaf from birth. Once activated, the conduct is automatic, and there is no way for the hero to break the conduct or to cure deafness, even with an artifact.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

As of commit ffb61612, permadeaf becomes an official conduct, and is logged in the achieveX field in xlogfile.

  • If your quest leader starts roaming, you cannot chat to them. However, the quest leader will still speak to you if you corner them in a corridor or other spot where they have nowhere to move.

TNNT (the game)

In TNNT (the game), the permadeaf conduct is available, and there is an achievement for receiving the quest with the permadeaf conduct intact. In the DevTeam quest, you cannot chat to devteam member Mike Stephenson, but can still complete the quest by throwing each scroll of missing code to him.

In the 2022 tournament, 4 players earned this achievement.[1] In the 2023 tournament, 4 players earned this achievement.[2]
